We were happy with the continental breakfast. Everything that one would expect from a continental breakfast with a really good choice of cereals, toast and jam, coffee/tea and even pain au chocolat. We had read mixed reviews on this hotel/hostel before and had kept our expectations low. With that as a starting point we were happy and we would stay again at this place. But bear in mind, this is really a mix of a hotel and a hostel. If you wish to stay at a nice hotel you may be disappointed. If you look for a nice hostel (upper range), this may just be your choice. Should we come back to Sydney it will probably be again our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Place to Stay in Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: Y Hotel Sydney This is my review of the time I spent staying at the Y Hotel IN Sydney, Australia I stayed here as my first spot to stay on Arrival in Sydney. It was very easy to access and not far at all from the airport. It was easy access to get to the Opera House and Sydney harbour, an only 15 minute walk. As well a free bus service was offered with the stop just outside of the door of the hotel. Very easy access to Hyde Park, as well several food stores and eating places within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself was quite basic but good. It had a good check in process. As I was early, they did offer a luggage storage area. Then later in the afternoon, I had quick check in and good run down of the area. Easy access to get to my room and the elevator worked very well. Room was very basic, but the price was right for what one would be getting. It was funny how the TV was located in the closet and I had to watch it sideways from the bed, otherwise ok. Had a good selection of coffee and tea with a nice water kettle. Bathroom was good size and provided a good hot shower on demand and very good. Plenty of clean white towels were provided as well on the stay. Not much of a view from outside of the window, but that was ok. As well, the hotel provided a decent included breakfast every morning. From toast and cereal, as well plenty of coffee and juices, very nice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget who wants to be near downtown Sydney and have easy access to the Harbour, but are not afraid to walk there. I would recommend this hotel for Single people or even families and couples on a small budget. I would suggest anyone to stay at this hotel when in Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but horrible stay!!”
Reviews.Author: trak83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Y Hotel with 3 of our friends (3 rooms in total) for a weekend to celebrate my partner's birthday. The location was pretty good but the hotel was shocking! We paid the extra and had the deluxe rooms which looked nice on the website but were horrible in reality. The rooms were very small and dirty, with stains on sheets, walls and floors. The bed was uncomfortable, really hard with bed bug. The mini bar was empty and the TV mentioned on the site was extremely small and was placed inside the wardrobe on the top shelf so you couldn't see it from the bed (there was nowhere else you could site in the room.) Continental breakfast buffet was included in the price but we paid extra to upgrade to a full breakfast. Not worth the money!! The food was inedible and we needed to find a cafe to get a proper meal. They also run out of danishes, bread and milk at 7.30 in the morning, so continental wasn't really an option. I'm glad we only stayed there for the weekend, though I would have paid more to go elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Price was right, but glad I didn't spend a lot of time there”
Reviews.Author: knickertraveler711
Reviews.Content: The location and price (WELL below other hotels in Sydney) attracted me to the Y Hotel Sydney, plus I found several reviews indicating it was safe and generally clean. I was in a single room with bath. The room itself was incredibly small but adequate. I was surprised that it even included a small refrigerator, hair dryer and safe. As far as cleanliness ... well, the bathroom was spotless and cleaned daily, the carpet passable, and sheets were clean. However, memories of the bedspread still linger. It was a dark sueded fabric on the outside, with a quilted off-white fabric on the underside. The underside had several large, unsightly stains, so unpleasant looking that I could scarcely bring myself to touch the bedspread. In hindsight, I should have called and asked for a clean one. Suffice it to say the Y Hotel would do well to revisit its bedspread cleaning schedule, this colored (literally) my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Ingriddv
Reviews.Content: Three years ago my husband and I stayed at the Y hotel City South. We were impressed by this hotel, but because it is a bit further away from the city center we booked the Y hotel Hyde Park this time. After entering the room we immediately regret that we booked this hotel. The room was dirty: blood stains on the carpet and lots of dust everywhere (especially in the airconditioning and exhaust fan ducts!). Beside that the air in the room was terrible and the bed unconfortable. The location of this hotel is great, but next time we stay in Sydney, we will book the Y hotel City South again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room change if you're not satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: rei11y
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 9pm after flying to sydney expecting a lovely room as the pictures on the website suggested... we were in for a shock. we got into our room and it was grubby, it smelled musty, it was worn down and scruffy, the air conditioning didn't work and the drawers were grotty =\ yuk. we were travelling to bondi the next day for a few days then returning to the same hotel for the weekend and were absolutely dreading it. when we arrived back on the saturday morning the lady on reception handed us the room card with the samenumber room we had stayed in so we refused to stay in it. we told her about when we had stayed in it a few nights previously and she was quite snotty and rude with us. she gasve us a key card for a room on the 8th floor and said she doubted there would be much difference but it was the best she could do! haha lovely customer service. we got to our room on the 8th floor and literally prayed to god before we stepped in. we couldn't believe the difference it was like a different hotel absolutely lovely room. even the shared facilities were nicer! my advice for this hotel is if you go and get a horrible room demand a room change you may be pleasantly suprised!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingwings
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double ensuite room in the Y Hotel for 5 night in January. The rooms were very clean and well equipped with good facilities. This hotel is centrally located and great value for money. The rate includes a basic breakfast. The cafe was not open while we were staying. They have good internet facilities and the reception will organise a shuttle bus to bring you to and from the airport. All the hotel staff were very friendly. Most of Sydney's main attractions are in walking distance and there is a bus stop to Coogee beach and Bondi beach around the corner from the hotel. All in all our experience was very good at the Y hotel and I would stay again if we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good, clean basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Y Hotel Hyde Park for a conference that was being held at the hotel. Whilst I had requested a room with an en-suite bathroom, these were all booked, and only a "traditional room" with a shared bathroom was available. I was expecting a very basic hotel with basic facilities, and that is what the Y Hotel had on offer. The room, whilst very small (barely larger than the double bed) was clean. The bed was comfortable and the linen was good. It was perfectly adequate and good value for the price (about $75 per night). My only gripe was the shared bathrooms. There was 1 male bathroom on the floor with 1 shower and 2 toilet cubicles. Thankfully I was up early enough not to encounter too much traffic, but this seemed less than adequate for the number of rooms. Overall, the Y Hotel met with my expectations for it (which were quite low), and was pleasant enough. Next time in Sydney, I will be back staying at my usual hotel - the Shangri La (although at 5 times the price).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little drab”
Reviews.Author: Mlinaqetu
Reviews.Content: We booked into a clean en suite double room. It was basic and not too roomy, but for the location it met our needs. The hotel booklet asked that if you want to boil the kettle to do it in the bathroom whilst having a shower due to the thermal heat detectors in the room.... A continental breakfast is currently included in the price with the option of upgrading to a hot egg and bacon breakfast for $4.50 each. We chose this hotel as it was advertised as having parking available, on arrival we found that the parking is in a private multi storey car park a couple of blocks away and it cost $20. This wasn't ideal but as we were there it had to do. This hotel is in a really good location, near to shops, especially Coles supermarket. The Harbour Bridge and Opera House are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rowvet
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in a reasonable location - with very good transport links. They were very helpful as we had to check in later than anticipated and our luggage actually arrived after us. Good breakfast which is included if you are in a double room although you may have to pay if in a dorm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mumbaicity
Reviews.Content: A nice and non-expensive hotel. There are many kinds of rooms and as a student I chose to share it with one more girl. The rooms were clean and airy. I had to share the toilet but it was quite clean. The overall experience was good and would like to stay here again if I visit Sydney. The location is pretty good as it is not very far from Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is easily Sydney's best value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NuggetAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The Y hotel is close tothe CBD and within walking distance of most of Sydney's inner attractions. There is the Hyde Park opposite and plenty of public transport nearby (including the Museum railway station). The hotel is very clean and they give you a breakfast every morning. The Y is not a luxury hotel but makes up for this with friendly, courteous staff and easy acessability.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room type!”
Reviews.Author: red0ne77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a standard room that had shared bathroom facilities- and would not recommend this. The shared bathrooms were pretty grim, and i upgraged to an ensuite which was far better. If you are going to this hotel, dont expect luxurious communal facilites or particularly friendly staff and make sure you stay in an ensuite room!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: paula-from-nz
Reviews.Content: A huge thank you to Billy(?) at reception who went out of his way to get us to the airport on time when our booked shuttle bus didn't up. He rang and gave the company a good talking to and then went out of his way to ensure we weren't late to catch our plane. The hotel itself has fairly basic rooms. We had a twin with shared bathroom facilities - which were nice and clean. Breakfast was included and basic with just toast and cereal, tea and coffee but for the price you can't complain. There were lots of choices of spread and cereal and they also do hot breakfasts for a small additional charge. The location is great, just a very short walk to museum station - maybe 3 minutes away. I would stay here again, you can't beat the location and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mjwriter
Reviews.Content: For the price you can't really go wrong with this choice. Even if you are a thirty- something like me, you will find a room to your liking. My sister and I stayed in a twin with en suite bath and really enjoyed ourselves. first of all, the location is great. You are a few minutes walk to the subway, dining and a pharmacy. it is rather run down so don't expect it to be really nice. However, it is comfortable and where we were (in the back away from the smoking rooms) we rarely heard any noise. They also have a laundry ($2 a load) and a cafe downstairs where you get cereal in the morning with the price of your room or you can pay extra for a cooked breakfast. We felt really safe there and we were two women traveling. The carpet was rather nasty so make sure you take footies or something. Just expect it to look like a hostel and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: HelsInTheSun
Reviews.Content: The reception area of the hotel was quite modern and spacious. When we arrived we were told that our rooms were ready which was good. We checked in very fast and arrived at our room. It was very small with a musty smell about it. It was clean(ish) but the room was very small with a tiny double bed to share (we had asked for a twin room). It was ok for a base to explore the city although I did feel that we were quite a bit of a walk out of everything and as we were only there for a few days I would have rather been closer to the centre so that we were not wasting time getting around. For the money that we paid for the room though I cant complain and we actually got breakfast included in the price too which was good to start the day! After travelling up the east coast of Oz we came back to the Y on the Park hotel for the last two nights and we were given a much nicer room on a higher floor with two twin beds and a little bit more space. This made a huge difference to our stay although the rooms still smelt musty and the room next door was being fumigated as there had been ants come in from the balcony. We shared facilities and each and everytime I used them I was suprised at how clean they were, so I could not fault them at this. On the last day of checking out, the manager Billy or Bobbie (shaven head from middle east) helped me with a problem I had with my airline and he spent time on the phone helping me out which I thought was very kind of him. I would recoemmend people stay here if they are on a budget but would like to explore this expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Given the location and price, very good indeed.”
Reviews.Author: tnbms16
Reviews.Content: Within easy walk of the harbour, and Hyde Park right on the doorstep. The room was small but had everything I needed, including a safebox. Staff were helpful, though perhaps not quite as efficient as they could be. Breakfast OK. Internet. All in all, a hassle-free place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for New Year with friends”
Reviews.Author: kat1978
Reviews.Content: Selected the Y on the basis of price over New Year in Sydney. Booked through the hotel website originally for 2 nights, but later emailed them to extend to 4 nights and received prompt emails back to sort this out. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised. Our triple traditional room was quite spacious with a big window over a balcony (which for safety reasons we could open or go out onto?). The shared bathroom was very clean and we rarely saw anyone else in it so felt very comfortable in there. The location on Hyde Park is great, a few restaurants and a 7/11 are close by. Darling Harbour is just 10 mins walk and the Opera House about 15-20 mins. The included breakfast was decent with a large bowl of cereal, toast and juice/ coffee, setting us up well enough for the day. The reception staff were helpful and we had no problems leaving our luggage in the store room on the final day, then coming back and using the bathrooms before heading off to the airport. Based on price alone, I would recommend here anyway - but additionally it is certainly a comfortable, well-located base from which to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money and clean.”
Reviews.Author: KennyM83
Reviews.Content: When we planned our backpacking trip of Australia in 2006 we expected that some of the places we would turn out to be actually not very nice, however, almost without exception, the places we ended up staying were extremely pleasing. The Y on the Park in Sydney was great value for money and had a location which meant it was easy to reach the major attractions of the city â€“ especially the landmarks. The communal areas of the property had a good atmosphere and the staff were extremely helpful when we were looking for information, directions and to book excursions. There was some basic food provision in the communal area which were available during normal â€œofficeâ€� hours, however, vending machines made up for this small gap. We booked a private room and were given a complementary upgrade to one with a bathroom when we checked in. The room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: garryoak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Y Hotel for 4 nights in a double deluxe room. The room was nothing special, but it was clean and was adequate for our needs. The included breakfast was cereal, toast, and juice - again, nothing outstanding, but it was fine. What really makes this hotel worth staying at is the great location for the price. It is right across Liverpool Street from Hyde Park and a five minute walk to Museum train station. It's about a 20 minute walk through Hyde Park and along McQuarrie Street to Circular Quay and the Opera House. The hotel is also located right at the beginning of Oxford Street, with lots of shopping and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again if I was looking for moderately priced accommodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised... eventually!”
Reviews.Author: ruthzmail
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on T.A. we arrived at the Y with some trepidation. We had booked 5 nights there after much searching for reasonably priced , but not too basic accommodation. We were given our room key and were really upset at the room, described as Double Deluxe, it was very small, the TV was on the top shelf in the wardrobe at the side of the bed! it would have been impossible to see it and nowhere to sit. We went straight back to reception and they patiently found us another room for our first night , a really nice 2 king bedded room!! The 2nd night we were moved to a very pleasant king bedded studio, which was perfect for our needs, even had a balcony. The staff were all very friendly, efficient and helpful and i would recommend the Y to budget conscious travellers who don't expect 5 star luxury. The 'free' breakfast was adequate and we just bought extras from the very nearby supermarket to make it more interesting. Cooked is available at very reasonable extra cost. The hotel is so well located, it would be had to imagine a better location, especially if, like us, you want to walk everywhere! All the main sites were within a 15 minute walk. There is traffic noise, it's slap bang in the CBD, but the actual hotel was very quiet. We would definitely stay again and would recommend to selected friends! Sydney was GREAT, so much to do and not enough time!!

Reviews.Title: “expensive for what you get...”
Reviews.Author: vike010
Reviews.Content: You know you can't trust websitepictures when you book a hotel. But this is absolutely the worst case I've seen. The pics are nice, but the place is horrible. A very noisy room, because the windows are too old and couldn't even be locked properly. The room was way too small as I couldn't even open my suitcase on the floor. The rooms and halls smell like cigarettes. The bathroom is very clean and the location is great, but in average you can state that you're paying too much for wht you get.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation - do i need to say more?”
Reviews.Author: MarkDom
Reviews.Content: I booked this accommodation as my family and i were going down to Sydney for a long weekend, and i must admit this place is AWLFUL! My first impression was of the foyer area, which was tidy and the guys on teh counter were friendly and very helpful with directions around Sydney. My impression quickly changed as soon as we went into the lift and onto our floor. The hotel has a musty smell of cigerettes. We orignally booked a dorm room thinking it would fine considering we were just using this as a base to explore sydney however after seeing the room we quickly new that it wouldn't easily fit 4 people comfortably. We upgraded to room with a shower. Much to my releif as i didn't really want to be walking down the corridor in my PJ's. The rooms aren't clean at all. The bedding had to be changed due to it was dirty, the cleaners don't clean under the bed and if you want to have a shower make sure you bring thongs to slip on. The balcony area is absolutely filthy with beer cans, dirty, cigerette butts and people's clothing on the floor. The hotel is noisy at night as the hotel is located between 2 hospitals. So if your looking for a full night sleep i would suggest this hotel isn't for you. In saying that the beds were comfortable and it was a place to put your head. The hotel is in much needed TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: aucklander16
Reviews.Content: I knew when I booked that the hotel was budget, but when I arrived there I was pleasantly suprised. I stayed in a single deluxe room and expected a really tiny room, but there was loads of space, a double bed would easily fit in there with room to spare. The room was at the back of the hotel so there was no traffic noise. The bathroom is compact, with walk in shower, basin and toilet. The double wardrobe was good, and it contained the personal safe, small refrigerator and small televison. Also an electric kettle is provided with tea/coffee. A previous reviewer noted the body lotion provided in the toiletry pack is good - I agree with her! The included breakfast is toast and cereal, they provided a choice of four different cereals, white or wholemeal bread, good selection of toast spreads, tea coffee and orange juice. Hot breakfasts are also available for purchase if desired. There is a good supermarket a short walk away on Oxford Street, which is handy for anyone staying in the area. Museum train station is close, but it is an old station, there are no lifts, so you have to carry your bag up the stairs. Overall it is a really good place to stay if you want to save money. I stayed in a room with a bathroom so I don't know what the other rooms with shared facilities are like.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the dorms!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of a friend, who had stayed in a double room and loved it. I was traveling solo, so I booked the female backpacker dorm (4 beds). The lobby was very nice, but when I stepped out of the elevator to get to my room, the look was quite shabby. The room wasn't bad at first glance, but after inspecting the beds more closely, I didn't like what I saw. The top sheet was very dirty and the linens were stained. Lockers in the rooms were tiny and several had old key locks that were rusted shut. Bags of fellow travelers filled the small spaces between the beds (bag storage is available, however). It didn't take long to decide that I wouldn't be staying there, but I had a look at two of the ladies' bathrooms on the way out. It was 2:00 in the afternoon and they were disgusting. There were dirty paper towels and pools of water everywhere. After checking back into the hostel I had just left that morning, I came back to the Y and canceled my reservation. I got a full refund, no questions asked. Definitely do not stay in the dorms here. It's not difficult to find budget accommodation of equal price with a much higher standard of cleanliness elsewhere in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: annabanana99999
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Room was OK. Bath had not been cleaned in ages - we had to scrub it prior to use. Evidence of prior bed-bug infestation on one of the matresses! There were 3 adults and one child in a triple delux room. Every day we had to request something that had not been replenished like towels, flannels, coffee etc. Beds were made daily but no cleaning - we stayed for 4 nights so really needed the bathroom cleaned eventually! Would stay again but only because of price. Definately not the 3.5 stars they rate themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget option”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: A bit on the downmarket side. My room came with shared facilities and there was only one male shower for the entire floor. Breakfast was basic, but was included in the room price. Staff were helpful and welcoming. Room prices are very low given the central location and if you're prepared to accept a basic level of comfort, this represents a decent value for money option. The hotel is a short walk from Central station, but if you're coming in by train from the airport, get off at Museum station, which is even closer.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: TedC
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in January over the first weekend of the Sydney Festival. Booked a studio for 560 AUDollars for four nights. Room was relatively clean with daily maid service. A bit tight but served the purpose adequately - bear in mind it is a hostel. Breakfast was ok and I found the staff helpful with any queries. Location is just off Hyde Park, on the junction of Liverpool Street & Oxford Street. Nearest station is Museum, about two minutes walk. 10 minute stroll to Darling Harbour, same to QVB. Budget accomodation - you get what you pay for. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Why you should stay at the Y”
Reviews.Author: humblebug
Reviews.Content: Can't speak more highly of the Y. Located in the centre of Sydney, it is very clean and comfortable, relatively modern with a low-moderately priced tarriff. Our room was compact but very well appointed - air con, ironing board and iron, tea/coffee making, fridge, TV, safe for small valuables, beds were very comfortable, breakfast was included in tarriff. Highlight for me was the bathroom - again compact but impeccably clean, fabulous shower, and the best thing... the mirror did not fog up!! We will definitley be staying at the Y in the future!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gaudi1234
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights Great location near downtown and oxford street. Walk everywhere! (almost :) 2 minutes walk from museum station (train from airport) Very very small room (deluxe twin) with fridge. Renovated bathroom, spotless Continental breakfast is fine Fair price for what you get (hotels are very expensive in sydney)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: embryonic4
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel using this website and must agree that it is a great deal. It has many different options when it comes to the accomadations available, from dorm room to hotel room. The best part is if you rent a dorm style room you get some of the benefits of staying in the same place as a hotel, security, service cleanliness that you may not get in a normal youth hostel. No matter what type of room you choos the prices are cheaper than any other hotels in they area. This is not because it is a "roach motel" but because it is run by a non- profit women's organization. So feel confident in booking your stay there. I flew down to sydney then ayer's rock and cairns for my trip to australia, then returned back to Sydney for five days. I pre-booked my hotels for myy first part of the trip. I was so impressed with the y on the park during my first part of the trip that i booked it again for my return to Sydney. I stayed in the dorm style room for the first part, then booked a regular room for the second. Despite sharing a bathroom with others I never had to wait to use the shower or anything the restrooms were kept clean and were evenly distributed.

Reviews.Title: “A1 BUDGET LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: andygeering
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there before, i had no hesitation in returning there to stay. The only downside is the staff could be more helpful. Apart from that it's excellent value for money compared to the neighbouring hotels i.e. the Marriott etc. Would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Yaxina
Reviews.Content: Good location in the centre of Sydney. Close to bus route to Bondi Beach. If you are looking for en suite accomodation, ensure this is clear on your booking form.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locality for budget stay”
Reviews.Author: ltamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the Y for 5 nights in Feb, because of its locality and reasonable reviews on Tripadvisor. Pleasantly surprised by a number of things.Firstly <20 mins from airport via excellent train links, only 2 stops to the main hub of Sydney (Circular Quay Station), <5mins walk to Museum station even with luggage this was a walk in the park. Secondly the park, the Y sits on the corner of Hyde Park,leading onto Botanic Gardens, great for a stroll if you don't want to get the train to CBD. The Y itself is looking a bit tired but is adequate for cheap accommodation. Room was large, I booked a double with shared facilities, not shy bout communal showering etc, but the guys shower/toilet 'block' had only 1 shower so repeated attempts for a shower may be required, I only had 1 occassion when I couldn't shower when I wanted. Cleanliness of the room was ok, a nozzle on the vacum to go round the edges of the room carpet would be of benefit, however I was only there to sleep @ night! Staff very friendly in all areas; breakfast servery/reception/cleaning/maids etc with exception of 1 male receptionist,though not enough to affect my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Tappetts
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for cheap no frills hotel in a great location look no further. We stayed in a deluxe room with garden view (not much of a garden) this meant it was quiet as not on the street side. Cost AUD$130 per night. The location is great within walking distance of everything and if you're lazy theres loads of taxis going past. This isn't a 4 star hotel but its clean and cheaper than almost anything else we looked at. We thought the staff were helpful (hired a car for us from just down the road, great for going into the blue mountains - better than a coach trip). Sydney is amazing, if you want to spend your money on the sights and not the hotel go to Y and spend your money on the bridge climb!!

Reviews.Title: “Y on the Park - OK for a cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: runningloz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice within a fortnight. The first room was overlooking the main road and a little noisy. The second room was higher and quieter. I had one of the rooms with the communal bathrooms and found my room small, but neat with everything I needed. The bathrooms were clean and I never felt threatened using communal bathrooms (my uni days are long behind me now!). The location is brilliant - close to the city, the sights of Oxford Street and Hyde Park. Breakfast was basic but adequate. My only real complaint was the desk staff - no matter who was on duty they were surly and could be a bit arguementative. But for budget accommodation in the heart of Sydney (walking distance to my work at the time!), I couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Ecnomoy Class Lodging in a First Class Location!”
Reviews.Author: DrOxford
Reviews.Content: If location and budget are your two main criteria, this is definitely the hotel for you. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Y on the Park in October during an extended holiday where economising with accomodation was important and chose the Y after extensively researching hotel options in Sydney. Located on the southeastern corner of Hyde Park, the place is ideally located for exploring Sydney and the surrounding area - a nice 10-15 minute walk to the opera house and harbour via the park, 5 minutes to George Street and shopping district, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, and 2 minutes to an underground station (15 minutes to airport). The Y offers various rooms to suit any budget and need, though, with that said, it probably is not worth staying in anything more than a Traditional Room (communal bathrooms) - we found the AU$90 a night to be the value-line between the Y and a normal hotel. The Y has a nice feel to it, but it is a budget hotel. Our Traditional Room was well outfitted (TV in the closet, safe, iron, tea kettle), but very dusty and unclean - we had to request cleaning service twice during our 4 night stay. Likewise, the duvet and sheets had seen there day. The staff were relatively helpful, though seemed put-out by our request for a clean room. On the other hand, the communal showers were quite tidy and well-kept. The standard breakfast is just that - standard! A bowl of cereal, a small cup of juice and coffee. Everything else is extra. If you are a budget traveler or a hostel-er, the Y is probably your best bet in Sydney based on the price and location. You will get more from it than you would a YHA or a Backpackers. If you are traveling in Sydney and less-financially concerned, I would definitely look for something else. As I stated earlier, if you want anything more than a Traditional Room you will get less from staying at the Y than you would at a similarly priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DurgaNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in November 2005 & found the staff friendly, the place clean & the bed comfortable. Good value for money & a great location, handy for shopping & visiting many attractions in Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: Y Hotel Hyde Park
HotelInfo.Address: 5-11 Wentworth Ave | 2000, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
